Bilateral small pleural effusions right more than left are re- demonstrated . Left mid lung opacity is noted and might potentially represent chronic changes . Non resolving pneumonia would be another possibility . .
bertscore: 1.  Large right lower lobe opacity worrisome for pneumonia.  Additional prominent linear opacity in the left mid lung could be due to prominent atelectasis or scarring, although additional site of infection not excluded. 2.  Bilateral, left greater than right, pleural effusions.

Findings alternatively, and less likely reflect loculated pleural fluid.  Please refer to same day Chest CT for further characterization.
